intro: Triceratostris hio, commonly known as the Hio spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant features small, greenish-yellow flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
